function.description: Converts the date to a date value corresponding to the provided `languageTag` parameter.

parameterDescriptions.parameterDescription: The date that will be changed.

This can be described using the [language]-[region] format. Examples are: "nl-nl", "nl-be", "en-gb", "en-us". If no `languageTag` parameter is provided, the general "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" format is used.
The style of the date section. Possible values are: null (default), 'full', 'long', 'medium' and 'short'.
The style of the time section. Possible values are: null (default), 'full', 'long', 'medium' and 'short'.

function.longDescription: Both the date and the time can be separately styled in five different ways using the `dateStyle` and `timeStyle` parameters. If the `timeStyle` is null, only the date will be returned. If the `dateStyle` is null, only the time will be returned. If both are null, both will be returned in their default format.
